Description: Fragment of oval handle from neck join to sharpish turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine pink-buff. Rectangular stamp.
Production date: 137 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 143.)
Curator's comments: Name Thersandros. Athenian Agora SS2672 is from the same die.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (253)
